description:
I'm standing here on the coast in Portugal, with my feet in a swimming pool looking out to the sea. Portugal has always been a proud seafaring nation. Its economic reach is 17 times that of its land territory, but it has to date really been unable to capture the economic potential of the ocean. Is that now about to change? I put this to Portugal's Minister of Agriculture, Seas and the Environment, Assuncao Cristas.

We have a national goal, that is until 2020 we want to increase in 50% the contribution of the Blue Economy to the Portuguese GDP, which we feel like a sustainable economy related to maritime issues from biotechnologies to shipping or to sports or to aquaculture, just to name a few.

What can be done with the ocean that you're not doing already?

For example, mineral resources we know that we have a lot. As we know we have a huge continental shelf, that is being broadened. Also aquaculture, we are the number two in the world's in the fish per capita consumption, and we import a lot of fish, namely codfish. And we feel that we have conditions to produce fish or bivalves. We are doing very well in oysters and mussels, and we think that is an area namely the offshore aquaculture that we might develop a lot.
